text: Poured a deposit pinkish purple color with aromas of rasberries, light oak, some funk, a touch of hay. Flavors are wet oak, light black raspberries, funk and some hay. Solid very drinkable not over the top sour but very good.
Deep black red, pink head, aroma of beetroot, raspberry jam, brett, flavor of beetroot, raspberry jam, brett, sour, dry, medium bodied.

750ml bottle pours out a dark deep purple with a small pink fizzy ring of a head. nose is great big black raspberry berries a tart sweet some light citrus notes and a little wood. Taste is more of the heavy black raspberry goodness a tart pucker. Man they kill it on the heavy fruit stuff wow.
Smell is faint berry. Taste is sour and tart blackberry and raspberry. Medium body, medium sharp carbonation, and no foam.

Bottle. Deep purple with a medium sized quickly diminishing red head. Lactic sour nose with some leather and black berries. Flavour is high on berries, pretty nice. Some lemon, lactic sourness, dust, wood, leather. Medium body, some sweetness, medium sour, lively carbonation. Short finish, but the berries linger. Nice.

Bottle from SlackerMads at Mikkeller and Friends. Pours an opaque dark ruby with no head. Sour and dry with an underlying sweetness. Aromas of almost ripe brambles with a tiny medicine hint. Also notes of black pepper and skyr. Medium bodied. Medium to lively carbonation. Super dry finish with more berries.

Bottle, thanks slackermads.
Pitch black colored with a medium sized purple head.
Fruity and light acidic aroma of oak with notes of raspberries.
Light acidic flavor of raspberries with notes of oak.
Tart finish.

bottle shared by a friend. the pour on this one is incredible. its as dark and thick as an black raz marmalada. with a non to long lasting head that is so dark purple that its almost black. carbonation is alive the entire time. hello fruit black razzberry goodness. this one is in your face! the black razz is dominated the entire time. with a very clear strong tart sourness, oak, and tons of funk. very strong dried oak, grains, and strong razzberry juice. taste has a strong tart kick, with a strong clear oak notice that adds a very nice demension with ofcourse razzberry, wich is everywhere. so thick and jammy. if you are a sour fruit beer lover you would love this one. very weird experience. but in a good way. this was so so good

Bottle shared with the Dangerous Bottleshares crew. Pours dark red with a pinky/purple head. Aroma of splashing de garde goodies. Lots of that tart yogurt with tons of raspberries and raspberry seed. Also some jam, funk and other sweet berries. Taste has obviously tons of raspberries. It is extremely sour but in a refreshing way. Also some jam and some funky and slight vinous notes - maybe a tad of black currants as well? Really a killer once again from De Garde!
Bottle shared with the Dangerous Bottleshares crew @ Fermentoren. Deep red pour with a purple head. Super juicy, raspberries, cherries, cranberries, leather, lactic and light acidic. Wow!

Bottle thanks to Bursprak da man on my birthday with the Dangerous Bottleshares buois. Pours blood red/purple with a big pink head. Aromas of raspberries, black berries, funk, green tart apples, jammy fruits and a lot of lactic sours. Taste has a lot of raspberries, blackberries, light green tart grapes, green apples, stone fruits, dry, lactic tart, black currants, berry jam. Holy shit this is complex. One of the best if not the best De Garde Ive had. Supah hawt!

Thanks! to Tinus. 750 ml. bottle sampled @ ZZT XIII. Very deep red purple, head doesnt sadly last, very deep bright pink. Looks gorgeous. Taste is amazing, red wine, red grapes, dark berries, huge raspberry & red fruits, red fruit, huge juice. Taste is puckering, strong sourness, huge fruit, red grapes, grape vines, plums, red grapes, cherry skins, huge fruit & wine, puckering dark berries, hard to describe. Carbonation is huge. Fruit on this one is insane, a touch better than the regular one I would say going by my scores. Spectacular brew. So much fruit.

Dark red crimson colour, pinkish red head. Fruity aroma, cherry, raspberry, red wine, Nero dAvola, plums, raspberry juice, cherry skin. Sour flavour, fruity, raspberries and sour berries. Very fizzy. Finish sour cherries and raspberry. Nice!
(from 75cL bottle shared @ ZZT XII, Getting Joesd to it Oirschot. From trade with jtclockwork. Thanks!)
Bottle @ ZZT, small sample. Dark color, short frothy head. Aroma is quite fruity, plums, tart, bit barnyard. Medium tartness in taste, very fruity, dark fruit. Well done.

Bottle thanks to Bursprak. Enjoyed at Fermentoren Aarhus with the Dangerous Bottleshares crew. Pours a murky.. well.. black, or at least very dark red. Even head is more red than pink. Aroma has very intense raspberry, blackberry, jam, red apples, black currant, lactic acidity, peach, lots of De Garde-funk.. Just crazy fruity! Taste is very sour with a huge, fruity tartness. Lactic, funky, juicy and oaky dry. Balance is great.. as well as everything else in this beer! High carbonation and a sparkling, acidic, crisp yet juicy body. Oh yis!
Roze paars ondoorzichtig bier met een goede roze schuim kraag. Ruikt fruitig, bessen, framboos. Smaakt goed zuur, framboos, droog. Lekkerrr.
Bottle @ ZZT XII. Opaque dark red color, virtually no head. Smell and taste huge red fruit or raspberries and very sour. Well, a bit too much for me but interesting anyway.

Bottle @ ZZT12. Bordeaux red colour with a dark pink to purple head that doesnt last long. Smells cherry, cherrypeel, red berry, sour. Tastes unbelievably fruity, cherry red fruit, berries, very sour. Heavy on the carbo, medium body. So sour.

Bottle via a friend who went to the quarterly release, thanks Larry! Pours an amazingly dark purple to black with a crazy pink head. De Garde continues to amaze me with the limited beers of theirs in terms of the presentation alone. Aroma is a jammy raspberry with slight corporate sweetness. Taste is a great vanilla raspberry pie with a moderate sour presence. The sour on this was not at all over the top but based on how much fruit there was this would have been upped a bit if the sourness was lowered and the fruit was allowed to dominate more. New Glarus VSB but more sour.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: Bottle. That sat over night. Purple still pour. Raspberry, funk, slight salty aromas. Flavors are tart raspberry and a touch of salinity.
Bottle. Nose is super fruity and yum. Pour is a crazy purple with crazy purple head. Taste is crazy tart but not acidic. Lots of fruit juice flavor but crazy cray tart. Yum.
Bottleshare thanks to homer. Pours a deep dark purple... Crazy color. Head fades fast. Aroma is fruity. Taste is super tart, mouth puckering. Like a tart fruit punch. Interesting.

The beer is a dark, nearly black purple. Bright purple head. Full raspberry aroma. Dark berry flavor. I havent had a black raspberry but this is what I imagine it tastes like. Nice tart pucker. It tastes a lot like the Purple version. Theres just a bit more depth of berry tartness, but Im not sure I would have noticed it without drinking the two side by side.

Poured from a bottle at the brewery. 
Aroma is very black raspberry forward. Some light lemon and citrus notes with hints of oak tannins. Really nice raspberry notes. 
Pours a very dark purple with a thin, dark purple head that recedes fairly quickly to the edges. No lacing or legs. 
Flavor is moderately acidic with lots of berry notes. Light oak notes. Very juicy and jammy with low bitterness. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a really nice berry forward beer. Nice drinking, slightly alcoholic berry juice. Some faint malt notes and oak.
Bottle. Pours dark brown dark head. Nose/taste of black raspberry, lactose, oak, sour lemon funk - medium body.

Bottle with much thanks to Matt! Shared among friends. Pours deep vibrant purple with a medium wine head; almost surreal really. Head dissipates fairly quickly but leaves pretty good lacing. How can that not be a 5? :) Aroma is mega-fruity, raspberries everywhere, some barnyard funk, a hint of lemon and a touch of grassiness. Flavor is light plus tart, fruity, raspberries and a bit of cut field grass. Light plus body, high carbonation. Very good.
Deep red black color with crazy purple foam. Brilliant fresh wild raspberry aroma. Tingly, tart, raspberry fruit. Very delicious and I have never had anything like it before.

Bottle thanks to Chow. Pours a murky purple with small pink head that diminishes to nothing. The aroma is red wine, blackberry and grape. Thin mouth, tart berry, wine, light acidic, really enjoyed this.

Poured from bottle to glass. Purple hue with fizzy red head that settled. Aroma is lactic, raspberry, straw. Mouthfeel is great with a medium light body and crisp carbonation. Taste is dry sweetness followed by a tart sourness throughout. Overall this is a nice brew.

UPDATED: OCT 21, 2015 Re-rate 10/15: Bottle shared at a sour tasting at Noams office. Amazing Deep red-purple color with a pink-purple head. Big funky aroma with lots of berries. Very sour flavor, full of berries, funky, lactic, with lemon, oak, wine, a bit of astringency. Spritzy mouthfeel. Really great. 8/5/8/4/17=4.2

[2/28/15] Draught at De Garde Brewing in Tillamook. Release and bottle share event. Amazing purple color with a huge pink-purple head. Amazing aroma with tons of berries, wine, barnyard and some lacto. Sourish flavor full of berries, some funk, wine, cobwebs, some lacto and earth. Rounded mouthfeel. Wonderful stuff. 9/5/8/4/17=4.3

On tap at De Garde. Pours one awesome sight, purple pink color with a massive foamy head that just looks so funny, dies down a but to a small white head. A big nose of red wine, oak, berries. The flavor is light and refreshing, vinous, funky. Lovely.
Draft - Blackberry, tart and sweet. Deep purple with no head. Earthy berry and tart. Almost like beets with some acidity.
